title: Iranian director Asghar Farhadi, who boycotted the Oscars in protest of Trump's travel ban, wins for foreign film
text: On Friday, the five directors nominated in the foreign-language film category — Denmark's Martin Zandvliet ("Land of Mine"), Sweden's Hannes Holm ("A Man Called Ove"), Germany's Maren Ade ("Toni Erdmann") and Australia's Martin Butler and Bentley Dean ("Tanna") — issued a joint statement that expressed their "unanimous and emphatic disapproval of the climate of fanaticism and nationalism we see today in the U.S." and dedicated the award to all the "people, artists, journalists and activists who are working to foster unity and understanding."
